title: Any indication where the patients clinical status/prognosis precludes intervention
High VE burden gt 10% on recent Holter
Exercise-induced VE burden
Sustained or paroxysmal AF or atrial flutter with new onset or change in clinical status
Sustained or paroxysmal SVT with previous ECHO and no change in clinical status
Ventricular arrhythmia
LBBB with no previous echocardiogram
RBBB with clinical suspicion of heart disease
RBBB without clinical suspicion of heart disease
comments: Primary care should refer to cardiology for review

title: Inherited channelopathy (e.g. Long QT)
Pre device implant
Infrequent supraventricular or ventricular ectopy with no clinical suspicion of heart disease
Sinus bradycardia
comments: Referral after discussion with specialist cardiology team. For discussion - consider not_indicated in all groups.

title: Tented T-waves in absence of history suggesting cardiac disease
LAFB in absence of history suggesting cardiac disease
Palpitations without proof of arrhythmia
Suspected heart failure and elevated NT-proBNP *
comments: Refer to 1-stop HF clinic where available. Where not available, reasonable for primary care to refer direct for ECHO. Timing of referral as per NICE Guidance 2018

title: Surveillance of known LV dysfunction to monitor effect of medical or device therapy
Surveillance of known LV dysfunction with change in clinical status
Family screening in subjects with 1st degree relative with inherited cardiac disease, inherited valvulopathy or inherited aortopathy.
Initial investigation in patient with suspected hypertensive heart disease
Baseline and serial re-evaluations in patients undergoing therapy with cardiotoxic agents
Reassessment  in patients on cancer therapies with significant (gt x2 ULN) rise in cardiac biomarkers [Troponin, NT-proBNP]
Hypotension in the absence of shock, clinical evidence of significant valvular disease or evidence of acute cardiac pathology such as AMI
Routine surveillance in patients with HFPEF
Routine surveillance of maximally treated patients with HFREF in whom no further intervention is being contemplated and whose clinical status remains satisfactory
Routine re-evaluation in hypertension without symptoms or signs of hypertensive heart disease
Sinus arrhythmia
Syncope with previous ECHO and no clinical suspicion of heart disease and/or history of possible ICC
Syncope with clinical suspicion of cardiac disease
Syncope with family history suggestve of ICC
Probable neurocardiogenic syncope
Chest pain with no other symptoms and no signs of cardiac disease and normal ECG
Chest pain with abnormal ECG
comments: ECG abnormalties do not include: sinus bradycardia, sinus arrhythmia or other changes not linked to coronary disease

title: Exertional chest pain
Non-exertional, non-pleuritic chest pain
Chest pain with FH of SCD or DCM
Chest pain with recent recreational drug use
Murmur with no clinical suspicion of cardiovascular disease and benign family history under the age of 50y and with no previous ECHO.
Murmur with clinical suspicion of cardiovascular disease
comments: Removed the word innocent for semantic reasons.

title: Pathological murmur
Chest wall deformities and scoliosis pre-operatively
Fatigue with no other signs and symptoms of cardiovascular disease, a normal ECG, and a benign family history
History suggestive of endocarditis with other findings that would fulfill Duke's criteria with or without ECHO
Fever screen or CRP screen without findings to fulfil Duke's Criterial for Endocarditis with or without ECHO
Central cyanosis
Isolated peripheral cyanosis
Genotype positive screen for ICC
Desaturation on pulse oximetry with no signs of cardiac decompensation
comments: indicated if suspicion of platypnoea orthodeoxia

title: Chromosomal abnormality known to be associated with cardiovascular disease
Chromosomal abnormality with undefined risk for cardiovascular disease
Cancer with suspicion of cardiac involvment on axial imaging
Muscular dystrophy
CKD IV or V with clinical suspicion of cardiovascular disease
Obstructive sleep apnoea
Diabetes with no clinical suspicion of cardiac disease
Dyslipidaemia with no clnical suspicion of cardiac disease
Suspected thromboembolic CVA, with no previous ECHO at, or after, event.
Peripheral arterial embolus with no obvious cause
Seizures, other neurologic disorders, or psychiatric disorders with no clnical suspicion of cardiac disese
Storage diseases, mitochondrial and metabolic disorders
Suspected PE, not confirmed
Confirmed acute PE where thrombolysis or thrombectomy may be considered (severe hypoxaemia, haemodynamic instability)
Confirmed PE where thombecomy or thrombolysis will not be considered regardless of ECHO findings
Severe deceleration injury or chest trauma where cardiac injury is possible or suspected
Routine evaluation in the setting of mild chest trauma with no electrocardiographic changes or biomarker elevation
Initial evaluation when there is a reasonable suspicion of valvular or structural heart disease
Routine surveillance (lessThan 5 year) of mild valvular stenosis without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance (gtorequal 5 y) of mild valvular stenosis without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance (lessThan1 y) of moderate valvular stenosis without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance (gtorequal 1 y) of moderate valvular stenosis without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance of trace valvular regurgitation with structurally normal valves
Routine surveillance (lessThan 5 y) of mild valvular regurgitation without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance (gtorequal 5 y) of mild valvular regurgitation without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance (lessThan 1 y) of moderate  valvular regurgitation without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Routine surveillance (gtorequal 1 y) of moderate  valvular regurgitation without change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Initial postoperative evaluation of prosthetic valve for establishment of baseline
Routine surveillance (lessThan 5 y after valve implantation) of bioprosthetic valve if no known or suspected valve dysfunction on post operative scan (excludes TAVI)
Routine surveillance (gtorequal 5 y after valve implantation) of bioprosthetic valve if no known or suspected valve dysfunction on post operative scan (excludes TAVI)
Evaluation of prosthetic valve with suspected dysfunction or a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Re-evaluation of known prosthetic valve dysfunction when it would change management or guide therapy
Suspected cardiac mass
Suspected pericardial disease
Evaluation of the ascending aorta in the setting of a known or suspected connective tissue disease or genetic condition that predisposes to aortic aneurysm or dissection (e.g., Marfan syndrome)
Re-evaluation of known ascending aortic dilation or history of aortic dissection to establish a baseline rate of expansion or when the rate of expansion is excessive
Re-evaluation of known ascending aortic dilation or history of aortic dissection with a change in clinical status or cardiac exam or when findings may alter management or therapy

Routine re-evaluation for surveillance of known ascending aortic dilation or history of aortic dissection without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam when findings would not change management or therapy (excludes bicuspid aortic valve related disease)
Routine re-evaluation of systemic hypertension without symptoms or signs of hypertensive heart disease
Re-evaluation of known hypertensive heart disease without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
To determine candidacy for ventricular assist device
Optimization of ventricular assist device settings
Re-evaluation for signs/symptoms suggestive of ventricular assist device-related complications
Monitoring for rejection in a cardiac transplant recipient
Cardiac structure and function evaluation in a potential heart donor
Routine surveillance (lessThan1 y) of known cardiomyopathy without a change in clinical status or cardiac exam or change in therapy
Initial evaluation of known or suspected adult congenital heart disease
Known adult congenital heart disease with a change in clinical status or cardiac exam
Re-evaluation to guide therapy in known adult congenital heart disease
Routine surveillance (lessThan2 y) of adult congenital heart disease following complete repair with no residual significant defect and no change in clinical status
Routine surveillance (gtorequal 1y) of adult congenital heart disease following complete repair with residual signficant defect or change in clinical status
Unchanged murmur in an asymptomatic individual with previous normal echocardiogram
Periodic repeat assessment of asymptomatic individual with haemodynamically-insignificant lesions, eg mitral annular calcification
Chest pain with haemodynamic instability
New murmur following acute or recent myocardial infarction
Assessment of infarct size, presence of complications and baseline LV function following MI
Evaluation of non-cardiac chest pain
Minor radiographic cardiomegaly in the absence of symptoms or signs of heart failure
Assessment of patients with oedema, normal venous pressure and no evidence of cardiac disease
Repeat assessment of small pericardial effusion without clinical change.
comments: Consider changing to trivial rather than small.

title: Lung disease with no clinical suspicion of cardiac involvement
Lung disease with clinical suspicion of cardiac involvement (cor pulmonale)
Suspected or established pulmonary hypertension
Evaluation of clinically suspected aortic coarctation
Routine assessment in hypertension
Repeat assessment for LV mass regression with treated HTN
Sustained or paroxysmal AF or atrial flutter without change in clinical status
Sustained or paroxysmal SVT - new onset or change in clinical status
Any indication where echocardiography will not change management
Routine surveillance (lessThan 6 months) of severe valvular stenosis or regurgitation without red flag symptoms
comments: RED FLAGS: Breathlessness; chest pain, palpitations or heart failure signs require urgent cardiology review. Presyncope; syncope: consider in-patient admission; New LV dysfunction (LVEF lessThan55% without other cause); Reducing LV ejection fraction

title: Routine surveillance (gtorequal 6 months) of severe valvular stenosis or regurgitation without red flag symptoms
comments: RED FLAGS: Breathlessness; chest pain, palpitations or heart failure signs require urgent cardiology review; Presyncope; syncope: consider in-patient admission; New LV dysfunction (LVEF lessThan55% without other cause); Reducing LV ejection fraction

title: Re-evaluation of severe valvular stenosis or regurgitation (lessThan 6 months) where red flag symptoms are present
comments: RED FLAGS: Breathlessness; chest pain, palpitations or heart failure signs require urgent cardiology review; Presyncope; syncope: consider in-patient admission; New LV dysfunction (LVEF lessThan55% without other cause); Reducing LV ejection fraction

title: Surveillance (lessThan 3 years) of bicuspid aortic valve with no stenosis and no more than mild regurgitation
Surveillance (gtorequal3 years) of bicuspid aortic valve with no stenosis and no more than mild regurgitation
Surveillance (lessThan 2 years) of bicuspid aortic valve with valve thickening and mild stenosis
Surveillance (gtorequal 2 years) of bicuspid aortic valve with early degenerative and mild stenosis
Bicuspid valve with signficant stenosis or regurgitation (lessThan 6 months) and no red flag signs
Bisucpid valve with aortopathy (gtorequal 12 months)
Annual surveillance of bioprosthetic valve replacement from year 5 onwards (excludes TAVI)
Routine surveillance of mechanical valve replacement, normal postoperative scan and no change in clinical status lessThan 10 years since implant.
Annual surveillance of TAVI valve if clinically appropriate
LBBB with previous satisfactory ECHO and no change in clinical status or where device therapy is not being considered.
LBBB with previous ECHO and change in clinical status or where device therapy is being considered
Routine surveillance in patient-prosthesis mismatch and no change in clinical status lessThan 1 year
Shortness of breath with normal NT-proBNP
P-wave abnormalities excepting bifid p-waves
Bifid p-wave suggestive of mitral stenosis
Left atrial thrombus
